> Greetings,

king in Eclipse.  I have defined an @After method in the superclass of all =
my test classes.  When I invoke the tests individually through Eclipse, my =

>

 uses JUnitCore to execute tests.  It runs all the tests as expected, excep=
t it does not execute the @After method for each test.

ing obvious I am missing or something I need to do to get JUnitCore to exec=
ute the @After routine?
